text: <@U0KPFAZNF> I'd like us to add a check for potential SQL injection in CI for our various projects
head explodes
heh
I created <https://jira.hyperledger.org/browse/FAB-1446> to track. I checked fabric and it comes up clean
sounds reasonable to me, though I have no idea on where that would go
but would be good add generally
agreed, thx
therefore we need to add it into the build of our base image for CI yes?
it being safesql
im not clear of the threat/fix, but if you think it should I trust you
I mean, I understand what SQL injection is in general, just not sure what the concern is in this context
well, we talked in TSC about getting the CII best practices badge
which strongly recommends that we add in static analysis scanning of the likes of this
so this is in response to that
is this a check of the code itself, or in the ci processes?
I'm looking for other tools we might use by examining other projects that do static analysis
of the code
e.g. is the concern that the code could be susceptible to sql injection and this is another "make checks" to look for it?
or are we worried about someone attacking jenkins itself
could be added to linters yes
ok, makes sense
no, this is just catching potential paths for someone to do sql injection attack on the system
<https://github.com/stripe/safesql>

attachments.title: stripe/safesql
attachments.text: safesql - Static analysis tool for Golang that protects against SQL injections

text: this may be a silly question: but would this only be a concern if we actually used sql?
we do
to my knowledge, we dont
oh!
i didnt realize
:wink:
Where do we use SQL?
membersrvcs did
oh right
I believe fabric cop
I remember these empty result set errors
people always complained about
fabric does use the database/sql package
yep fabric-cop does
this all seems reasonable to me
hmmm... this may be more challenging than I had thought... exposes errors in dependencies
<@U0KM61BCP|cbf> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/cbf/F3G8J9A6N/-.txt|Untitled>

file.name: -.txt
file.title: Untitled
